As our nation struggles to cope with COVID-19, I'm fighting to keep @USPS funded, put a stop to letter and package backlogs, and ensure on time delivery of critical mail. Our health, our businesses, even our democracy are on the line. We must protect the Postal Service.

The Postal Service is also a lifeline for our small businesses. According to a 2019 report, more than 70% of small businesses depend on @USPS to deliver their packages, and more than half of small businesses say they ship with the Post Office most frequently.

The VA fills 90% of veteran prescriptions by mail. That's almost 120 million prescriptions a year, with deliveries arriving daily to about 330,000 veterans across the country. We can't let partisan politics get in the way of maintaining this essential service.

Oklahomans rely on @USPS to keep their businesses running, to get prescription medications, to vote, and to stay connected. Whether they face rain, sleet, snow, or a pandemic, our postal workers keep America running. We must come together to fund this critical service.

Mr. President, these are just a few examples of how important the postal service is to my constituents, and how your sabotage campaign is hurting the American people you swore an oath to serve.

Tod, a veteran from Lebanon County, emailed: "what's going on right now with the post office is endangering not just my life but the Lives of every veteran. Our medication is not arriving when we need it I went over a week without my Blood pressure Meds <sic>"

Brett, a small business owner in Lancaster County, wrote: "As a small, home-based business, I rely exclusively on the Post Office for delivery of orders to my customers, and my wife relies on receiving medications by mail."

Kay in Adams County, PA wrote to me: "I use mail order for my Glaucoma eyedrops which have always been delivered within 24 hours as they need to be refrigerated. UNTIL NOW. I have been without eyedrops for four days now and counting."

Anne wrote from NEPA: "As a rural Wayne County voter, the post office is a lifeline. My husband is disabled and receives a worker's comp check every two weeks. It now arrives five days later than it used to."

Norman, U.S. Army Vietnam veteran from Erie County, wrote in a letter to me that "there are already delays in service. I receive several medications through the VA for a service related disability. I have prescriptions right now that are not being delivered."

We cannot let our adversaries succeed, either in letting the embargo lapse or destroying the US veto. I applaud the Trump Administration for its efforts to hold Iran accountable and look forward to ensuring the Iranian regime does not receive a blank check to buy and sell arms.

What's more, as @Rich_Goldberg argued in @ForeignPolicy over the weekend, the stakes are larger than the arms embargo itself. China and Russia are using the arms embargo to contest the US veto that sits at the heart of the modern multilateral system. https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/08/15/dont-let-iran-blow-up-the-u-n-security-council/

So the question is this: will we use our right--a right that was central to the campaign to sell the JCPOA to the American public--to protect our nation from China, Russia and Iran? Or will we side with China & Russia, and all the nefarious actors who want to buy Iranian weapons?

To its credit, the Obama admin negotiated language in a UN Security Council Resolution giving the US the right to snap back all sanctions on Iran at precisely a time like this. If you read UNSCR 2231, it's clear that the US retains that right today.

In May, I joined nearly 400 members of Congress in urging @SecPompeo to do all he could to keep the embargo alive. China and Russia don't want that to happen. They want to sell Iran advanced weapons and draw US attention away from their malign activities.

THREAD‚û°Ô∏èIn October, a crucial UN arms embargo of Iran will expire, allowing adversaries like China and Russia to sell the world's leading sponsor of terror advanced weapons that it will use to further destabilize the Middle East, threaten the US, and endanger our allies.
